inair.view

Class UIView

  • java.lang.Object
    • inair.data.DependencyObject
      • inair.data.IAElement
        • inair.view.UIView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAInputElement
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UIImageView, UILayeredViewItem, UIRectView, UITextView, UIViewGroup

    public class UIView
extends IAElement
implements IAInputElement

    This class represents the basic building block for user interface components. A View occupies a rectangular area on the screen and is responsible for drawing and event handling. View is the base class for widgets, which are used to create interactive UI components (text fields, image, etc.). The UIViewGroup subclass is the base class for layouts, which are invisible containers that hold other UIViews (or other UIViewGroups) and define their layout properties. 

     Attribute for UIView can use in layout xml file

 attr name="id" format="reference" getId()
 attr name="alpha" format="float|string" getAlpha() setAlpha(float)
 attr name="width" format="float|string" getWidth() setWidth(float)
 attr name="height" format="float|string" getHeight() setHeight(float)
 attr name="isFocusable" format="boolean|string" isFocusable() setIsFocusable(boolean)
 attr name="positionX" format="float|string" getPositionX() setPositionX(float)
 attr name="positionY" format="float|string" getPositionY() setPositionY(float)
 attr name="positionZ" format="float|string" getPositionZ() setPositionZ(float)
 attr name="borderThickness" format="float|string" getBorderThickness() setBorderThickness(float)
 attr name="borderColor" format="integer|string" getBorderColor() setBorderColor(int)

    The API will likely change in later updates of the compatibility library, requiring changes to the source code of apps when they are compiled against the newer version.

    Copyright (c) 2014 SeeSpace.co. All rights reserved.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UIView

        public UIView(Context context)
        Simple constructor to use when creating a view from code.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context the view is running in, through which it can access the current theme, resources, etc.

      • UIView

        public UIView(Context context,
      AttributeSet attrs)
        Constructor that is called when inflating a view from XML. This is called when a view is being constructed from an XML file, supplying attributes that were specified in the XML file. This version uses a default style of 0, so the only attribute values applied are those in the Context's Theme and the given AttributeSet.

        The method onFinishInflate() will be called after all children have been added.

        Parameters:
        context - The Context the view is running in, through which it can access the current theme, resources, etc.
        attrs - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view.

      • UIView

        public UIView(Context context,
      AttributeSet attrs,
      int defStyle)
        Perform inflation from XML and apply a class-specific base style. This constructor of UIView allows subclasses to use their own base style when they are inflating
        Parameters:
        context - The Context the view is running in, through which it can access the current theme, resources, etc.
        attrs - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view.
        defStyle - An attribute in the current theme that contains a reference to a style resource to apply to this view. If 0, no default style will be applied.

      • setAlpha

        public void setAlpha(float alpha)
        Set alpha for this view

        if value less than 0, it will be transparent like 0 alpha

        if value greater than 1, it will be opaque like 1 alpha

        Parameters:
        alpha - float value in range of [0..1]

      • attachNode

        public final void attachNode()
        Final method attachNode Call for attach this view to render tree

        when view is attached, graphic of view will appear on screen after all resources of this view are loaded in core system

      • onFinishInflate

        protected void onFinishInflate()
        Finalize inflating a view from XML. This is called as the last phase of inflation, after all child views have been added. Even if the subclass overrides onFinishInflate, they should always be sure to call the super method, so that we get called.

        Invalidate the whole view

        public void requestLayout()
        Call this when something has changed which has invalidated the layout of this view. This will schedule a layout pass of the view tree.

        protected void onAddHandler(RoutedEvent routedEvent,
                Delegate<? extends RoutedEventArgs> handler)
